Generation V.Black: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
Generation V.White: Incredible jaw strength enables them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey.
Generation V.Black 2: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
Generation V.White 2: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.

Generation VI.X: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
Generation VI.Y: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.

Generation VII.Sun: It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.
Generation VII.Moon: Active both on land and in the sea, this Pokémon drags its land-based prey into the water to finish it off.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.

Generation VIII.Sword: Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta's own shell grows thick and sturdy.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.
